required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Basic Investigations Into Congenital Disorders of Glycosylation
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Basic Investigations Into Congenital Disorders of Glycosylation

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to study the natural history of congenital disorders of glycosylation and its causes and treatments.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators are conducting a natural history study of patients with congenital disorders of glycosylation (CDG). The study will look into the progression of the disease amongst the participants and also look at the clinical symptoms and how they vary amongst different diseased population groups. The participants will be asked to fill out questionnaires either on their own or with a provider that will grade the severity of disease and document symptoms and diet. Participants will have an opportunity to submit blood, urine, and stool samples that will be tested for biomarkers for CDG.
Participants will also complete dietary food records, physical exams, CDG scores, and the PROMIS questionnaires to assess disease progression and severity.

primary_outcome.measure: Indicators of Disease Severity and Progression - organ system involvement
primary_outcome.time_frame: Length of study, up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Establish the prevalence and severity of specific morbid indicators of disease severity through use of the Nijmegen Progression CDG rating scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Indicators of Disease Severity and Progression - degree of cognitive disability
primary_outcome.time_frame: Length of study, up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Establish the prevalence and severity of specific morbid indicators of disease severity through use of the Nijmegen Progression CDG rating scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Indicators of Disease Severity and Progression - case-fatality
primary_outcome.time_frame: Length of study, up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Establish the prevalence and severity of specific morbid indicators of disease severity through use of the Nijmegen Progression CDG rating scale.

biospec_descr.textblock: Stool, urine, and blood can be retained for biomarker testing. DNA may be a part of this testing in the future.

study_pop.textblock: All patients included in the study must have genetic confirmation of a primary congenital disorder of glycosylation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with congenital disorders of glycosylation based on genetic confirmatory testing
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients without congenital disorders of glycosylation

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data and samples may be shared with other investigators at the discretion of the PI. Only participants who have consented to sharing data/samples will be included in this portion.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
